title: Issue cropping videos in analyze_videos (cannot unpack non-iterable bool object)
body:
Hello! 
Hope someone can help with this, thanks in advanced :) 

**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, anaconda env, deeplabcut 2.2b6

**Describe the problem**
I'm trying to crop videos while using deeplabcut.analyze_videos function.
I have set cropping to True and I have changed the cropping parameters in the config file. 
Given the error, it looks like it is not recognising the cfg x1, x2, y1, y2 that I have modfied in the config. 

```
In [13]: deeplabcut.analyze_videos(config_path,['/home/mariaroa@dc.cube.local/DLC_locom
    ...: ouse/locomouse_uncropped/8B#10_Pax5-p.R31Q_D3_6_L-R.mp4'], videotype='mp4', sa
    ...: ve_as_csv=True, cropping=True)
```

Full terminal output with error: 

```
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-13-313e0830977d> in <module>
----> 1 deeplabcut.analyze_videos(config_path,['/home/mariaroa@dc.cube.local/DLC_locomouse/locomouse_uncropped/8B#10_Pax5-p.R31Q_D3_6_L-R.mp4'], videotype='mp4', save_as_csv=True, cropping=True)

~/anaconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/predict_videos.py in analyze_videos(config, videos, videotype, shuffle, trainingsetindex, gputouse, save_as_csv, destfolder, batchsize, cropping, get_nframesfrommetadata, TFGPUinference, dynamic, modelprefix, c_engine, robust_nframes)
    161     if cropping is not None:
    162         cfg["cropping"] = True
--> 163         cfg["x1"], cfg["x2"], cfg["y1"], cfg["y2"] = cropping
    164         print("Overwriting cropping parameters:", cropping)
    165         print("These are used for all videos, but won't be save to the cfg file.")

TypeError: cannot unpack non-iterable bool object
```
